title: Promise.race() - First to Finish
description: Use Promise.race() to get the first resolved promise
instructions:
Write an async function `fastestResponse(delays)` that takes an array of delay times (in ms) and returns the index of the fastest one (smallest delay). Use Promise.race() to determine which promise resolves first.

Each promise should resolve with its index after its delay time.

Example: fastestResponse([100, 50, 200]) should return 1 (index of 50ms)

hints.content: Create a promise for each delay that resolves with its index. Use Promise.race() to get the first one to complete.
Use map() to create an array of promises. Each promise should setTimeout for the delay time and resolve with the index. Pass the array to Promise.race().
Use: `const promises = delays.map((delay, index) => new Promise((resolve) => { setTimeout(() => resolve(index), delay); }));` then `return Promise.race(promises);`

learningObjectives: Using Promise.race() to get first result
